projects.name: Gamehub
projects.summary: Gamehub is a single-page application (SPA) that I conceived and developed entirely on my own. As a personal project aimed at demonstrating proficiency in the MERN stack, Gamehub draws inspiration from platforms like Steam. Leveraging both front-end and back-end technologies, I engineered this platform from the ground up to ensure a smooth and immersive shopping experience for users.
projects.description:
Gamehub is a personal project developed to showcase proficiency in the MERN stack. Inspired by platforms like Steam, I aimed to create a similar experience while adding unique functionalities. As a single-page application (SPA), Gamehub simulates an online store for video games, providing users with a platform to browse, explore, and interact with game listings. Leveraging React for the front-end and Express.js for the back-end, Gamehub implements robust user authentication using JSON Web Tokens (JWT) and ensures secure password hashing with bcrypt. MongoDB serves as the database, facilitating dynamic inventory management through change streams, allowing real-time updates to game availability.
Key features of Gamehub include an interactive game catalog, user account management with distinct privileges for gamers and developers, and responsive cart functionality for seamless browsing and purchasing experiences. The platform prioritizes usability and responsiveness, with an intuitive interface designed to guide users through the browsing and purchasing process effortlessly. Throughout the development process, my biggest struggle and reward was building the search bar and logic from scratch, a challenge that ultimately contributed to the platform's unique functionality and my growth as a developer.
I invite you to explore Gamehub and experience the culmination of my efforts. Building this project has been an immensely rewarding journey, and I'm excited to share it with you. You can visit the Live link for the website or check out the code by clicking on the Code Link below.
projects.tech: HTML, CSS, JavaScript, React, MongoDB, ExpressJS, NodeJS, Heroku, Git

projects.name: Psych Bite
projects.summary: Psych Bite is a unique application designed to provide users with a daily dose of inspiration and insight from notable authors in the fields of finance, psychology, and faith. Developed in collaboration with another developer, my role as a backend developer focused on building the server-side and subscription management. This service delivers a random quote to subscribers' email inboxes every morning at 7 am. With Psych Bite, users can kickstart their day with a bite of knowledge and motivation.
projects.description:
Psych Bite emerged from a collaborative effort to deliver daily doses of inspiration through motivational quotes sent directly to users' email inboxes. As the project's backend developer, I focused on building the server-side infrastructure and managing the email subscription system. Leveraging Node.js and Nodemailer, I ensured the smooth delivery of quotes at 7 am each morning, ensuring a timely and consistent user experience. Meanwhile, my teammate took charge of frontend design, crafting an intuitive and visually appealing interface that enhanced user engagement.
Collaborating within a Git and GitHub environment presented initial challenges as we worked separately on our respective ends. Coordinating tasks and integrating backend and frontend components required clear communication and meticulous planning. However, through effective teamwork and a shared commitment to excellence, we overcame these obstacles and delivered a product that surpassed expectations in terms of efficiency and quality.
Now, users can kickstart their day with a bite of knowledge and motivation by subscribing to Psych Bite's daily quotes. Join our community of motivated individuals and experience the power of inspiration firsthand. Visit the live link to explore Psych Bite and subscribe to start your day on a positive note.
projects.tech: MongoDB, React, NodeJS, ExpressJS, Nodemailer, Git, Heroku

projects.name: Meals To Go
projects.summary: Meals To Go is a React Native app developed to test my knowledge of mobile app development using Expo CLI and the Google Maps API. This personal project was inspired by the desire to create a convenient solution for finding restaurants based on the city you search for. Leveraging React Native's capabilities, Meals To Go offers a user-friendly interface and seamless navigation experience.
projects.description:
Meals To Go represents a significant milestone in my journey as a mobile app developer. Developed entirely as a personal project, it serves as a testament to my proficiency in React Native and my ability to integrate third-party APIs seamlessly. The integration of Firebase for user authentication and Google Maps API for restaurant search functionality posed notable challenges, but overcoming these obstacles resulted in a rewarding learning experience.
Although there isn't a live version of Meals To Go, you can explore the codebase on GitHub to see how it was built and dive into the details of its functionality. Your feedback and suggestions are always welcome as I continue to refine and enhance this project.
projects.tech: HTML, CSS, JavaScript, React Native, Expo, Firebase, Git

projects.name: The Roaming Spoon
projects.summary: The Roaming Spoon is a collaborative web app project developed by General Assembly students. It serves as a platform for users to discover and explore nearby food trucks, providing essential information such as location, contact details, and reviews. As a full-stack developer on the project, I focused on connecting the backend and frontend components, particularly emphasizing the search functionality. This project not only demonstrates my technical skills but also highlights my ability to collaborate effectively in a team environment.
projects.description:
Roaming Spoon, a collaborative web app project, transforms the food truck experience by providing users a seamless platform to discover and explore nearby food trucks. As a full-stack developer, I focused on connecting the backend and frontend, particularly the search page.
Navigating group collaboration posed initial challenges, especially as it was my first experience with a group project. Learning to divide code responsibilities and synchronize efforts through Git and GitHub required clear communication. However, these challenges taught valuable teamwork and version control skills, enhancing our development process.
The Roaming Spoon app empowers users to effortlessly find their favorite food trucks and access essential information like location, contact details, and reviews. With user-friendly filters for browsing by distance, cuisine, rating, and price, the app ensures a smooth experience.
This project, a culmination of efforts by General Assembly students, showcases the synergy between software engineering and UI/UX design. Our collaboration resulted in a dynamic and user-friendly platform that enhances the food truck experience.Ready to explore? Visit the the live version or view the project's code repository.
projects.tech: HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Google, React, Bootstrap, NodeJS, MongoDB, Git, Heroku

projects.name: Wars of Volgrora
projects.summary: Wars of Volgrora is a thrilling turn-based RPG game crafted with vanilla JavaScript, where players embark on a heroic quest to save their planet. With a variety of character combinations and strategic battles, players must overcome challenges to emerge victorious. Developed as a personal project, Wars of Volgrora marks a significant milestone in my journey as a developer, showcasing my initial foray into HTML, CSS, and JavaScript development. Join the adventure and become the hero Volgrora needs!
projects.description:
Enter the immersive world of Wars of Volgrora, a turn-based RPG adventure crafted with vanilla JavaScript. As the planet's hero, you must confront the looming threat of evil forces. Choose from 18 unique character combinations to customize your hero's stats and background, using hover-over tooltips for strategic planning.
Upon entering the game, you'll find yourself in a world of peril and adventure, with clear player information guiding your decisions. Navigate the store to purchase potions for battle enhancement, but keep an eye on purchasing limits. Manage your resources wisely to prepare for battles against enemies.
This project marked my first foray into HTML, CSS, and JavaScript development, posing a significant challenge. Integrating these technologies to bring Wars of Volgrora to life demanded patience and perseverance. However, through dedication, I overcame these hurdles and created a functional RPG experience, showcasing my evolving skills.
Ready to embark on your own adventure? Experience the thrill of Wars of Volgrora by exploring the live game or dive into the code on GitHub. Join the ranks of adventurers in the quest to save Volgrora from destruction. Are you ready to become a legendary hero?
